result.execSummary:
The defendant August C Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, August C Schmidt appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Status from Atty Anderson, sites agreement.  State agrees. State moves to amend to Possession of THC. Motion is granted. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis.  Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. $299.00 60 DTP. 


16TR577-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. $761.50,  DL Rev. 6 months. AODA Assessment. Refusal is vacated.  60 DTP

15TR578-Dismissed by State's motion.

Atty Anderson states there will be a waiver of the preliminary exam. Court finds the def. has freely and knowingly waived his right to a preliminary exam.  Court finds there is probable cause. Not to consume or possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a license. Not to consume any alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on premises.
